name: (3-chloropropyl)trimethoxysilane
Reason: 1,3,5-Trimethoxysilane has a melting point of around -100°C due to the presence of three methoxy groups, which increase the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The chlorine atom introduces a strong withdrawing group, raising the melting point by approximately +50°C. The propane chain contributes to the melting point due to its rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C.
